metadata.title: CVE-2017-3653 mysql: Server: DDL unspecified vulnerability (CPU Jul 2017) (low)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: Server: DDL). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.56 and earlier, 5.6.36 and earlier and 5.7.18 and earlier. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 3.1 (Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

criterions.comment: mariadb-galera-server is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
mariadb-galera-common is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
